column4: Alrighty, I've got a question. I posted this on the Ubuntu forum yesterday and got no reply.

I can play audio just fine. I can play video just fine. However, when I'm playing a video there is never any audio alongside it. I've played multiple files and filetypes (avi, mpeg) with multiple media players (Totem, VLC, etc) and yet I still see people talking and no voices.
This isn't a blanket audio problem. I can play mp3s, flacs, even with the same programs. It's just that when I'm playing a video there isn't any audio, nomatter which player I use.
paste the output from ''amixer'' onto http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
then give me the url
what is amixer?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/5862 that's my amixer
eh?
you need to prefix every line with my nick, because I'm in approximately 70 irc channels
understood
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/5862
sec
k
do you actually need the Headphone Jack Sense and Line Jack Sense elements unmuted?
Probably not. I'm just using speakers. I haven't really messed with that stuff. Default breezy install.
I HAVE sound though
just not sound that goes along with avi and mpeg
I know, I'm asking if toggling those changes anything. There are known quirks with your symptoms on certain chipsets.
How would I toggle those? I'm pretty much a newbie.
open a Terminal, then, amixer sset 'Headphone Jack Sense' off
did that
Should I see if I get sound with video now?
yes
OK. I'll get back to you.
still no sound
ok, then revert the change you just made
next I'll need strace output from your video player of choice as you test
strace -o debug.txt -fF $somePlayer
amixer sset 'Headphone Jack Sense' on ?
yep
I entered "strace -o debug.txt -fF vlc" into the terminal. It brought vlc to the foreground.
That's for assisting me, crimsun.
er, thanks
ready for the next step
bzip2 the debug file and post it on the Web somewhere
Where did it put that debug file?
wherever you were
k
get debug.txt.bz2 from http://esnips.com/web/andrewrsm-stuff
get debug.txt.bz2 from http://esnips.com/web/andrewrsm-stuff
that file is imparsable
I'll upload somewhere esle
taostrategos.com/temp01/debug.txt.bz2
Let me know if that doesn't work either...
requires authorization
usr: linkrjh pass: pararescue1
Is it safe to assume you were about to get the file?
no, I lacked authorization as I previously stated
I sent you a username as password you could use.
If you would rather not use a login, I can change dirs.
change directories, please. I'm trying to assist in several channels simultaneously.
http://www.taostrategos.com/temp01/debug.txt.bz2 [nolonger requires authorization]  (afk a second, dog's gotta potty)
any luck? did you pass me a url?
Try that url again. I removed the authorization requirement
http://www.taostrategos.com/temp01/debug.txt.bz2 [nolonger requires authorization]
I was afk a sec.
downloaded.
Great.
don't have time this sec to inspect it; give me 5 minutes
I'll be here.
what filename did you try to play?
one sec
S9E10 - The Strike.avi among others
ok, if you're using vlc, ''vlc -vv'' will be more useful for me
oh!
have you installed vlc-plugin-alsa ?
I have not, unless it came with the greater package.
I'll apt-get it
installing. I'll try with the plugin
installed plugin. problem is still persisting
should I carry out your former suggestions?
make sure you select the alsa plugin in vlc's audio output preferences (enable advanced options)
k
audio:output modules:ALSA saved, still no noise
ok, what sound hardware do you have?
is this with Breezy or Dapper Flight 2?
breezy
Is there a command I can use to get info about my hardware?
lspci -v |grep -i audio
0000:00:1f.5 Multimedia audio controller: Intel Corp. 82801BA/BAM AC'97 Audio (rev 05)
ok, then you'll need to file a bug on bugzilla.ubuntu.com against linux with all the details you've given.
I've made it clear that I can get audio when playing a flac or mp3, right?
This isn't just a an audio problem. My speakers make noise. The problem is that there's no audio when I play video files.
That's why I don't think it's a hardware problem.
I can't help you beyond sound problems; the fact that it works intermittently points to something deeper than just an application-layer issue
are you using .asoundrc or something?
I don't know what .asoundrc is
ok, then that's about the extent of my troubleshooting atm. I don't deal with stuff other than audio.
Thanks for your help.
My sound is working now. Worked after a reboot.
Thanks for all your help man. I really appreciate it.
good.
